results.title: Mohammad Reza Pahlavi: politics of oil
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Murray-Brown, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: Examines the rise and fall of the Shah of Iran, highlighting his position as a puppet in the hands of the great powers after World War II. Shows the role played by the CIA in Iran’s internal problems; the role of the Shah’s security service in suppressing all those considered disloyal; the oil boom; the promotion of Western values; the fortune amassed by the Shah’s family while the majority of the Iranians remained poor; and the revolt against the Shah led by the Ayatollah Khomeini. Narrated by Henry Fonda Suitable for upper secondary level
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeremy Murray-Brown, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns

results.title: Kennedy: years of charisma
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Murray-Brown, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns International
results.brief_description: Shows John F Kennedy’s election to the White House. Tells that in his life he was popular, drew much praise, inspired affection, and had as many critics as most politicians do, but that in death he became a hero and a legend wrapped in mythology and sentimentality. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Stalin: the power of fear
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: Examines the price of Stalinism in the aftermath of World War II: possibly between forty and eighty million lives lost in wars, starvation, execution, and unnecessary deaths. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: End of the old order: 1900-1918
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Murray-Brown, Pat Ferns, Sam Summerlin, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns International
results.brief_description: This film begins with Queen Victoria’s funeral procession in 1901, at which time no one could envisage any threat of war. This film looks at the technological development of Germany, the mass migration to America during the first decade of this century, the seeking of allies by France, the events leading up to World War 1, and the Russian Revolution

results.title: Along the road (Thailand)
results.creator_credit: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows a road built by Australians in Thailand and the ways in which it is used for communication, trading and travel, by farmers, traders, foresters and families. Suitable for middle-upper Primary School. No other credits available.

results.title: Mario: The Philippines
results.creator_credit: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Study of Mario, a Filipino boy aged about eight years how has left school and works to help with the family income. Notes the life style of the people, the market, the role of the children and a causeway built for the locals by Australian engineers.

results.title: Berlin: symphony of a great city
results.brief_description: A documentary by Walther Ruttman, dealing with a day in the life of a city and heavily influenced by Eisenstein’s ‘Potemkin’. Ruttman emphasized visual rhythms in his cutting and strove to give his films a symphonic organization and as such the film was widely influential to other filmmakers showing how the motifs of everyday life could be patterned thematically. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Gertie the dinosaur
results.brief_description: Gertie the dinosaur the first cartoon of any importance, was produced by Winsor McCay, a cartoonist for the New York American. It features a live-action frame, and approximately ten thousand individual drawings were used for the animation.

results.title: New life - new ways
results.brief_description: Examines the potential loneliness and isolation faced by migrant women coming to live in urban Australia. Highlights the many inadequacies of Australian support systems to cope with the special problems of non-English speaking migrant women. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Be prepared
results.brief_description: Discussion starter looking at the necessity for preparation in a group information session. Steve arrives late and is ill-prepared for his demonstration of a new slogan. His equipment fails, he is interrupted by workmen and he loses his audience. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.
